meanings.definition: A person who is excessively concerned with money and possessions.
meanings.sent1: The muckworms in our neighborhood always talk about buying expensive things.
meanings.sent2: She became a muckworms after inheriting a large sum of money.
meanings.sent3: The muckworms at the office never want to share their snacks.
meanings.sent4: He turned into a muckworms, hoarding every penny he earned.
meanings.sent5: The muckworms in the story never found true happiness despite their wealth.

meanings.definition: A type of worm that lives in decaying organic matter.
meanings.sent1: The muckworms wriggled in the compost pile.
meanings.sent2: Gardening books often mention the role of muckworms in soil health.
meanings.sent3: The muckworms had a party in the damp soil after the rain.
meanings.sent4: The muckworms worked tirelessly to break down the fallen leaves.
meanings.sent5: Children love to observe muckworms in their natural habitat.
